title: PNCA launches Albert Camus’ The Stranger by SADEQUAIN
content:
ISLAMABAD, Oct 28 (APP):The Pakistan National Council of the Arts (PNCA) hosted the historic launch and exhibition of Albert Camus’ The Stranger by SADEQUAIN, marking the first-ever display of this extraordinary collection in Pakistan.

The event was inaugurated by the Ambassador of France to Pakistan, Nicolas Galey, with President of Alliance Française d’Islamabad, Iram Rehman,  serving as Guest of Honor, said a press release.

Organized by Gallery 21 and the SADEQUAIN Foundation, the exhibition celebrates Sadequain’s rare 1964 lithographs inspired by Nobel Laureate Albert Camus’ seminal novel The Stranger— a remarkable confluence of French literature and Pakistani art.

The event drew artists, writers, diplomats, and cultural enthusiasts who gathered to witness this symbolic reunion of art and literature, bridging the creative worlds of Paris and Pakistan six decades later.
